key_risks: Class action lawsuit alleging misleading financial disclosures
Revenue decline due to weak printer sales
Intense competition in the additive manufacturing industry
controversies: $20 million settlement with the U.S. Department of State for export control violations
$4.54 million settlement for False Claims Act violations related to improper data transfers to China
Past labor disputes, including a 2013 NLRB case
environmental_issues: Supply chain disruptions impacting production and profitability
social_issues: Labor disputes and workforce management challenges
governance_issues: History of export control violations raising compliance concerns
Ongoing class action lawsuit impacting investor confidence

sources.title: New Class Action Lawsuit Accuses 3D Systems of Misleading Investors
sources.snippet: A new class action lawsuit filed in New York federal court accuses 3D Systems Corporation of misleading investors about the company's internal financial controls. The proposed class action was filed April 9 by Plaintiff Troy Kehoe on behalf of anyone who purchased publicly traded securities of 3D Systems between May 6, 2020 and March 1, 2021.
